definition:
An integer $n$ that in a given base $b$ is a palindrome. Given $n$ being
$k$ digits $d_x$ long in base $b$, its value being
$$n = \sum_{i = 0}^{k - 1} d_kb^i$$ then if the equalities $d_k = d_1$,
$d_{k - 1} = d_2$, etc., hold, then $n$ is a [*palindromic number*]{}.
There are infinitely many palindromic numbers in any given base.
